act:act.act:title: Canadian Pacific Railway (Stone and Timber) Settlement Act

bcl:text.#text: means the Canadian Pacific Railway Company;
means Action No. S134003 in the Vancouver Registry of the Supreme Court;
means a grant or disposition of railway land by a historic railway company;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the British Columbia Southern Railway Company;
the Columbia and Kootenay Railway and Navigation Company;
the Columbia and Western Railway Company;

bcl:text.#text: includes a claim, estate, right or title;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that was granted by the government to a historic railway company, and

that was, at the time of the grant referred to in paragraph (a), located in a district lot set out in Column 1 of the Schedule in the land district, or the division of the land district, set out opposite in Column 2;

bcl:text.#text: means the settlement agreement between CPR and the government in relation to the current action;
means a term or condition included in a historic grant of railway land that reserved or purported to reserve one or both of the following to the historic railway company:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an interest in stone, including, without limitation, valuable or marketable stone, in, on or under the railway land;
interests incidental to the interest referred to in paragraph (a), including, without limitation, interests respecting the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: ingress to and egress from the railway land;
the right, upon payment of compensation, to extract and carry away stone from the railway land;
the right to take and use the railway land to carry on operations incidental to the right referred to in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph;

bcl:text.#text: means an interest resulting from a stone reservation;
means a term or condition included in a historic grant of railway land that reserved or purported to reserve one or both of the following to the historic railway company:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an interest in wood, timber or trees on the railway land;
interests incidental to the interest referred to in paragraph (a), including, without limitation, interests respecting the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: ingress to and egress from the railway land;
covenants of the grantee limiting the cutting of wood, timber or trees on the railway land;

bcl:text.#text: means an interest resulting from a timber reservation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: All stone reservation interests held by CPR are extinguished.

A historic grant of railway land that includes a stone reservation in respect of which the stone reservation interest is extinguished under subsection (1) must be read as if the stone reservation had not been included in the historic grant of railway land.

For certainty and without limiting subsection (2), that subsection applies for the purpose of determining the extent of an interest, if any, that a person holds in railway land after the extinguishment of a stone reservation interest under subsection (1).
All timber reservation interests held by CPR are extinguished.

A historic grant of railway land that includes a timber reservation in respect of which the timber reservation interest is extinguished under subsection (1) must be read as if the timber reservation had not been included in the historic grant of railway land.

For certainty and without limiting subsection (2), that subsection applies for the purpose of determining the extent of an interest, if any, that a person holds in railway land after the extinguishment of a timber reservation interest under subsection (1).

bcl:text.#text: has the same meaning as in the ;
has the same meaning as in the .

bcl:text: Despite any enactment, if a stone reservation interest or timber reservation interest
the registrar, on application by a person who is an owner in respect of the railway land, may cancel the registration of the stone reservation interest or timber reservation interest.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is extinguished under section 2 (1) or 3 (1), as applicable, and

bcl:text.#text: remains registered under the  in favour of a historic railway company or CPR, or any other person, against a title to railway land,
For certainty, the following take effect without any registration or cancellation of registration under the :

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the extinguishment of a stone reservation interest or timber reservation interest under section 2 (1) or 3 (1), as applicable;
any change to the extent of an interest in railway land resulting from an extinguishment referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The payment of compensation by the government to CPR under the settlement agreement constitutes full and final settlement of all claims by CPR against any person, whether or not the person is named or described in the current action, in relation to any of the following matters:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a matter that is raised or referred to in the current action;
a matter that could have been raised or referred to in the current action;
the enactment of this Act including, without limitation, the extinguishment of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: timber reservation interests under section 3 (1), and
claims by CPR under subsection (2) of this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: All claims by CPR against any person in relation to any matter referred to in subsection (1) are extinguished.

bcl:text.#text: means the date this section comes into force;
means a title, grant, transfer, easement, disposition, lease, licence, permit, agreement or other instrument created or issued by, or entered into with, the government.

bcl:text: is confirmed and validated, effective on the date the resource instrument was created, issued or entered into, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: was created, issued or entered into before the effective date, and
would have been valid had stone reservations and timber reservations not been included in any historic grant of railway land

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the government is conclusively deemed, at the time a resource instrument referred to in paragraph (a) was created, issued or entered into, to have had the authority to create, issue or enter into the resource instrument.

bcl:text: Despite any enactment, all things done, before the effective date, under a resource instrument or an enactment that would have been validly done
are conclusively deemed to have been validly done.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: had this section been in force on the day they were done, and
had stone reservations and timber reservations not been included in any historic grant of railway land

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person has no right of action and must not commence or maintain an action or other proceeding against the government for compensation or damages in relation to the enactment of this Act.
For certainty, sections 5 (2) and 7 do not apply to a claim, action or proceeding by CPR or the government to enforce or determine a right or obligation under the settlement agreement.

bcl:text.#text: Section 5 of the  does not apply to this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This Act is retroactive to the extent necessary to give full force and effect to its provisions and must not be construed as lacking retroactive effect in relation to any matter because it makes no specific reference to that matter.
This Act comes into force by regulation of the Lieutenant Governor in Council.

bcl:editorialnote.in:em: [Note: See Table of Legislative Changes for the status of section 12.]
